qas.question: Which highway is an extension of the Chrysler Freeway?
Which highway runs through the northern suburbs of Detroit?
Michigan uses what letter to designate roads that connect major highways?
Which highway runs north from I-75 to the junction of I-96 and I-696?

context: <a4_0>I-275<a4_0/> runs north–south from I-75 in the south to the junction of I-96 and I-696 in the north, providing a bypass through the western suburbs of Detroit. <a0_0>I-375<a0_0/> is a short spur route in downtown Detroit, an extension of the Chrysler Freeway. <a2_0>I-696<a2_0/> (<a1_0>Reuther Freeway<a1_0/>) runs east–west from the junction of I-96 and I-275, providing a route through the northern suburbs of Detroit. Taken together, I-275 and I-696 form a semicircle around Detroit. Michigan state highways designated with the letter <a3_0>M<a3_0/> serve to connect major freeways.
